title: A monotype corsiva twin sister :)
content:
Hello all,

Please help, I'm looking for the long lost "monotype Corsiva" twin sister :)

I've attached the original letter, the Corsiva example, and a superimposed one.  
Please note the letters have been stretched, yes, but even stretched, the Corsiva does not match 100% : the leg and foot are different.

Anyone up for this challenge ?  
Sandra :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [original.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201606/http:/typophile.com/files/original_5.jpg) | 16.3 KB |
| [monotype.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201606/http:/typophile.com/files/monotype.jpg) | 12.82 KB |
| [superimposed.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201606/http:/typophile.com/files/superimposed.jpg) | 12.24 KB |
author: kamoue

comments.content:
You wrote: "...I'm looking for the long lost "monotype Corsiva" twin sister" "

Long-lost? Perhaps you can elaborate on this -- I have never heard of a "lost" version.

I meant this in a figurative way :)...I'm just looking for the similar font  
Thanks!

If you're trying to identify a font the best place is here:  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201606/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")  
or you can click on the "Font ID" link at the top of the page.

EDIT: now in the Font ID forum  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/114779](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201606/http:/www.typophile.com/node/114779 "http://www.typophile.com/node/114779")
